      List<String> execute() 
      StreamingOperation<IndexEntry> executeStreaming()
      Performs an index query as a streaming operation from Riak Note that you must call StreamingOperation.cancel() on the returned StreamingOperation if you do not iterate through the entire result set.

      FetchIndex<T> maxResults(int maxResults)

      • executeStreaming

        public StreamingOperation<IndexEntry> executeStreaming()
                                                throws RiakException
        Performs an index query as a streaming operation from Riak Note that you must call StreamingOperation.cancel() on the returned StreamingOperation if you do not iterate through the entire result set. Note this is only available using Riak 1.4
        Returns:
        A StreamingOperation
        Throws:
        RiakException

      • maxResults

        public FetchIndex<T> maxResults(int maxResults)
        Pagination support for 2i queries. Will return maxResults entries starting at the lower range or the continuation returned from a previous query This is only available in v1.4+ of Riak and only via streaming
        Parameters:
        maxResults -
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        executeStreaming()

      • returnKeyAndIndexValue

        public FetchIndex<T> returnKeyAndIndexValue(boolean returnBoth)
